author: Reuters Editorial
title: Ireland votes to liberalize abortion laws with 66 percent in favor
text:
DUBLIN (Reuters) - Ireland voted by a landslide to liberalize its highly restrictive abortion laws as 66 percent of the electorate backed a referendum, official results showed on Saturday.
People celebrate the result of yesterday's referendum on liberalizing abortion law, in Dublin, Ireland, May 26, 2018. REUTERS/Max Rossi Voters in the once deeply Catholic nation were asked if they wished to scrap a prohibition that was enshrined in the constitution by referendum 35 years ago, and partly lifted in 2013 only for cases where the motherâ€™s life was in danger.
Over 64 percent of eligible voters cast their ballot, one of the highest ever for a referendum.
Reporting by Padraic Halpin; Editing by Toby Chopra
